snippet: The Obama administration’s decision to temporarily permit the export of limited amounts of oil to Mexico may lessen the effects of a glut in domestically produced petroleum.
abstract: Commerce Department grants oil companies temporary permission to export limited amount of oil to Mexico; glut is hurting domestic petroleum profits and employment; falls short of lifting ban on crude exports that was established in the 1970s.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration’s decision to temporarily permit the export of limited amounts of oil to Mexico may lessen the effects of a glut in domestically produced petroleum.

headline.main: U.S. Allows Limited Oil Exports to Mexico
headline.print_headline: U.S. Allows Limited Oil Exports to Mexico, but Won’t Lift Longstanding Ban
